gurmukhi: ੳੁਠੇ ਟੋਪ ਟੁੱਕੰ ਕਮਾਣੰ ਪ੍ਹਾਰੇ ॥ ਰਣੰ ਰੋਸ ਰੱਜੇ ਮਹਾਂ ਛੱਤ੍ਰ ਧਾਰੇ ॥੭੧੧॥
transliteration: Outhe Top Toukkan Kamaanan Prahdare|| Ranan Ros Rajje Mahaan Chhattra Dhdare||711||
translation: The helmets broke with the blow of arrows and the great sovereigns were highly enraged in the battlefield.711.

gurmukhi: ਫਿਰਯੋ ਅਪ ਦੲੀਤੰ ਮਹਾ ਰੋਸ ਕੈ ਕੈ ॥ ਹਣੇ ਰਾਮ ਭ੍ਰਾਤੰ ਵਹੈ ਬਾਣ ਲੈ ਕੈ ॥
transliteration: Phiryo Ap Daeetan Mahaa Ros Kai Kai|| Hane Raam Bhraatan Vahai Baan Lai Kai||
translation: That demon in great rage revolved and showered a volley of arrows on the brother of Ram;

gurmukhi: ਰਿਪੰ ਨਾਸ ਹੇਤੰ ਦੀਯੋ ਰਾਮ ਅੱਪੰ ॥ ਹਣਿਯੋ ਤਾਹਿ ਸੀਸੰ ਦ੍ਰਗਾ ਜਾਪ ਜੱਪੰ ॥੭੧੨॥
transliteration: Ripan Naas Hetan Deeyo Raam Appan Haniyo Taah(i) Seesan Drougad Jaap Jappan||712||
translation: The arrows which was given by Ram for the destruction of the enemy, Shatrughan discharged it on the demon, repeating the name of Durga.712.

gurmukhi: ਗਿਰਯੋ ਝੂਮ ਭੂਮੰ ਅਘੂਮਯੋ ਅਰਿ ਘਾਯੰ ॥ ਹਣਯੋ ਸਤ੍ਰ ਹੰਤਾ ਤਿਸੈ ਚੳੁਪ ਚਾਯੰ ॥
transliteration: Giryo Jhoom Bhooman Aghoomyo Ar(i) Ghaayan Hanyo Sattra Hantaa Tisai Chaoup Chaayan||
translation: The enemy received a wounded and while revolving, he fell down on the earth and he was killed by Shatrughan;

gurmukhi: ਗਣੰ ਦੇਵ ਹਰਖੇ ਪ੍ਰਬਰਖੰਤ ਫੂਲੰ ॥ ਹਤਯੋ ਦੈਤ ਦ੍ਰੋਹੀ ਮਿਟਯੋ ਸਰਬ ਸੂਲੰ ॥੭੧੩॥
transliteration: Gadan Dev Harke Pra-barkhhant Phoolan|| Hatyo Dait Drohimityo Sarab Soolan||713||
translation: The gods were overjoyed in the sky and began to shower floweres; with the killing of this malignant demon, all their agony ended.713.

gurmukhi: ਲਵੰ ਨਾਸੁਰੈਯੰ ਲਵੰ ਕੀਨ ਨਾਸੰ ॥ ਸਭੈ ਸੰਤ ਹਰਖੇ ਰਿਪੰ ਭੇ ੳੁਦਾਸੰ ॥
transliteration: Lavan Naasuraiyan Lavan Keen Naasan|| Sabhai Sant Harkhe Ripan Bhe Udaasan||
translation: All the saints were delighted with the destruction of the demon named Lavan; the enemies became depressed,

gurmukhi: ਭਜੈ ਪ੍ਰਾਨ ਲੈ ਲੈ ਤਜਯੋ ਨਗਰ ਬਾਸੰ ॥ ਕਰਯੋ ਮਾਥੁਰੇਸੰ ਪੁਰੀਵਾ ਨਵਾਸੰ ॥੭੧੪॥
transliteration: Bhajai Praan Lai Lai Tajyo Nagad Baasan|| Daryo Maathuresan Pureevaa Navaasan||714||
translation: And fled away after forsaking the city; Shatrughan stayed in the city of Mathura.714.

gurmukhi: ਭਯੋ ਮਾਥੁਰੇਸੰ ਲਵੰਨਾਸ੍ਰ ਹੰਤਾ ॥ ਸਭੈ ਸਸਤ੍ਰ ਗਾਮੀ ਸੁਭੰ ਸਸਤ੍ਰ ਗੰਤਾ ॥
transliteration: Bhayo Maathuresan Lavannaasra Hantaa|| Sabhai Sastra Gadmisoubhan Sastra Gadtaa||
translation: After destroying Lavan, Shatrughan ruled over Mathura and all the weapon-wielders gave the blessings of good wishes to him.

gurmukhi: ਭੲੇ ਦੁਸਟ ਦੂਰੰ ਕਰੂਰੰ ਸੁ ਠਾਮੰ ॥ ਕਰਯੋ ਰਾਜ ਤੈਸੋ ਜਿਮੰ ਅੳੁਧ ਰਾਮੰ ॥੭੧੫॥
transliteration: Bhae Doust Dooran Darooran Su Thaamannd|| Daryo Raaj Taiso Jiman Audh Raamannd||715||
translation: He ended all the tyrants and ruled over Mathura like Ram ruling over Avadh.715.

gurmukhi: ਕਰਿਯੋ ਦੁਸਟ ਨਾਸੰ ਪਪਾਤੰਤ ਸੂਰੰ ॥ ੳੁਠੀ ਜੈ ਧੁਨੰ ਪੁਰ ਰਹੀ ਲੋਗ ਪੂਰੰ ॥
transliteration: Kariyo Duat Naasan Papaatant Sooran|| Outhijai Dhounan Pur Rahilog Pooran||
translation: On destroying the tyrant, the people of all directions hailed Shatrughan; his fame spread in all the directions nicely;

gurmukhi: ਗੲੀ ਪਾਰ ਸਿੰਧੰ ਸੁ ਬਿੰਧੰ ਪ੍ਹਾਰੰ ॥ ਸੁਨਿਯੋ ਚੱਕ੍ਰ ਚਾਰੰ ਲਵੰ ਲਾਵਣਾਰੰ ॥੭੧੬॥
transliteration: Gadpaar Sindhan Su Bindhan Prahaaran|| Souniyo Chakkra Chaaran Lavan Laavanaaran||716||
translation: And the people came to know with great zeal that demon Lavan had been killed.716.
Now begins the description about the Exile of Sita :

gurmukhi: ਭੲੀ ੲੇਮ ਤੳੁਨੈ ੲਿਤੈ ਰਾਵਣਾਰੰ ॥ ਕਹੀ ਜਾਨਕੀ ਸੋ ਸੁਕੱਥੰ ਸੁਧਾਰੰ ॥
transliteration: Bhaiem Taounai Itai Raavanaaran|| Kahijaanakiso Soukatthan Sudhaaran||
translation: It happened then like this and on this side Ram said to Sita with love:

gurmukhi: ਰਚੇ ੲੇਕ ਬਾਗੰ ਅਭਿਰਾਮੰ ਸੁ ਸੋਭੰ ॥ ਲਖੇ ਨੰਦਨੰ ਜੳੁਨ ਕੀ ਕ੍ਰਾਂਤ ਛੋਭੰ ॥੭੧੭॥
transliteration: Rache Ek Baagad Abhiraamannd Su Sobhan|| Lakhe Nandanan Jaoun Kikraant Chhodhhan||717||
translation: “A forest may be created, seeing which the brightness of Nandan forest (of heaven) be dimmed.”717.
